title: How to Make Smore Buckets

steps.headline: Crush the graham crackers in a plastic sandwich bag until they break into pea-sized pieces.
steps.description: Avoid over-crushing because you don't want to end up with powder.

steps.headline: Divide the crumbs into 4 to 6 small ramekins or small tea cups.
Make the chocolate pudding according to the instructions on the box.
steps.description: Divide the pudding equally among the ramekins. Gently tap the cups on the counter to release any air bubbles from the pudding.

steps.headline: Place the marshmallow fluff in a sandwich bag.
steps.description: Turn the bag into a piping bag by cutting a small corner of the bag. Pipe the fluff onto the pudding. It helps if you start in the center of the cup, and pipe your way outward in a spiral.

steps.headline: Place the cups in the refrigerator for an hour.
steps.description: This allows the marshmallow to settle.

steps.headline: Toast the marshmallows.
steps.description: Use a cooking torch to lightly toast the marshmallows or place the cups in the oven on a baking sheet. Put it under your broiler as close as possible to the top on a high temperature setting (around 370 degrees) with the oven door slightly ajar until the marshmallow browns.

text: Crush the graham crackers in a plastic sandwich bag until they break into pea-sized pieces. Avoid over-crushing because you don't want to end up with powder. Divide the crumbs into 4 to 6 small ramekins or small tea cups.  Make the chocolate pudding according to the instructions on the box. Divide the pudding equally among the ramekins. Gently tap the cups on the counter to release any air bubbles from the pudding. Place the marshmallow fluff in a sandwich bag. Turn the bag into a piping bag by cutting a small corner of the bag. Pipe the fluff onto the pudding. It helps if you start in the center of the cup, and pipe your way outward in a spiral. Place the cups in the refrigerator for an hour. This allows the marshmallow to settle. Toast the marshmallows. Use a cooking torch to lightly toast the marshmallows or place the cups in the oven on a baking sheet. Put it under your broiler as close as possible to the top on a high temperature setting (around 370 degrees) with the oven door slightly ajar until the marshmallow browns. Finished.
